home.title: Home
home.lastKmsgDesc: last_kmsg contains a dmesg + bootloader log of the last time your device was rebooted (intentionally or through a crash). It's useful for diagnosing kernel panics and crashes.
home.dmesgDesc: dmesg shows the current kernel ring buffer (logs). This is useful for diagnosing issues that occurred after boot.
home.tooltipUnsupported: This kernel version is too old and may not be fully compatible with this module. Please update your kernel.

features.title: Features
features.tooltipReboot: The running kernel's value and boot partition's value are mismatched! A reboot might be pending to apply changes.
features.tooltipReadOnlyAllowed: Changing this feature's state is temporarily allowed, but will not be saved.
features.tooltipReadOnlyBlocked: This feature's state cannot be changed from the UI normally (read-only).

tweaks.title: Tweaks
tweaks.loadDefaultDesc: This will load the default tweak values from your kernel.
tweaks.loadPresetDesc: This will load the values from "{name}".
tweaks.loadPresetWarning: This will override and save your current settings.
tweaks.deletePresetConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete preset "{name}"?
tweaks.presetNamePrompt: Enter a name for the preset:
tweaks.overwriteConfirm: Do you want to overwrite "{name}" or save as a new preset?

zram.title: ZRAM
zram.disableWarningBody: This will have a major negative impact on performance and your device may experience freezes.
zram.disableWarningNote: Only disable ZRAM if you know what you are doing!

thermal.title: Thermal Modes
thermal.desc0: Disables throttling completely. The Big cluster will run at max frequency until 120°C shutdown.
thermal.desc1: Stock throttling. Frequencies: 2288 → 2132 → 2002 MHz. This is the default mode.
thermal.desc2: Custom throttle frequency. Set your own throttle limit in KHz.
thermal.desc3: Less aggressive throttling. Frequencies: 2400 → 2288 → 2208 MHz. Runs hotter.

undervolt.title: Undervolt
undervolt.notice: Undervolt settings were cleared because you enabled or changed the Unlocked Mode. This prevents crashes from incompatible undervolt configurations.
undervolt.highValueWarning: Values above 10% are almost guaranteed to cause an immediate crash. You may enter a bootloop until the module is disabled.
undervolt.unlockConfirmBody:
Values beyond 15% have no practical use and will cause immediate instability.

Are you sure you want to unlock the full range?

tooltip.zram: Compressed RAM block device. Helps multitasking by compressing data in RAM. Usually, higher size translates to more apps fitting in ZRAM.
tooltip.memory: Settings to control the Linux Virtual Memory (VM) subsystem. Adjusts how the kernel balances performance, battery life, and multitasking.
tooltip.gpu: Sets the maximum GPU frequency. Higher values improve performance but use more battery.
tooltip.display: HBM boosts max brightness under sunlight. CABC adjusts backlight based on content to save power.
tooltip.ioScheduler: Algorithm used to order and merge I/O requests. Affects storage performance and latency.
tooltip.thermal: Controls Big cluster CPU throttling. Mode 3 is aggressive performance, Mode 1 is stock-like, Mode 0 disables throttling (dangerous!).
tooltip.undervolt: Reduces voltage to save power and reduce heat. Not recommended with Overclocking (Unlocked Mode).
tooltip.blockEd3: Disables Ear Detect Mode 3, which prevents the display from lowering its refresh rate when the virtual proximity sensor is engaged. Also makes the proximity sensor less sensitive.
tooltip.gpuClkLock: When enabled, prevents the GPU min/max frequencies from being changed. Useful for locking GPU clocks to a specific range.
tooltip.gpuUnlock: Enables GPU overclocking immediately. Only works in Superfloppy overclock modes (1, 2, 3). Greyed out if Unlocked Mode is disabled or in non-OC modes.
tooltip.soundcontrol: Adjust headphone and microphone gain in decibels. Higher values increase volume. Use Split L/R to control left and right channels independently.
tooltip.chargingBypass: Stops battery charging while allowing device to run from USB power. Useful for gaming to reduce heat.
tooltip.chargingFast: Forces up to 900mA charging current over standard USB connections (e.g. PC ports).
tooltip.adrenoboost: A replacement boosting algorithm for Adreno GPUs that replaces the default one.
tooltip.adrenoidler: An algorithm that makes the boosting of the GPU less aggressive, making it tend to go idle more.

modal.experimentalBody:
Features exposed by enabling this toggle might be unfinished, unsupported, or dangerous.

Proceed with caution.
modal.readonlyBody:
This allows patching features marked as read-only.

Use only for testing. Changes will NOT be saved.
modal.applyChangesBody:
This will flash the feature-patched kernel to your device.

This involves risks.
modal.rebootPendingBody:
Are you sure you want to {action}?

You have unapplied changes that will be lost!
